notes: The solution is mathematically correct and unique. Velocity is the integral of force (scaled by mass); the maximum occurs when the derivative (force) transitions from positive to negative ($t_2$).
The question is conceptually strong, testing the distinction between maximum acceleration ($t_1$) and maximum velocity ($t_2$).
Difficulty and style are well-aligned with ESAT/ENGAA standards (conceptual, non-calculator).
